item.title: Vampire Crawlers Demo Releases Next Month
item.content:encoded:
Vampire Crawlers fans can check out the game through a demo arriving for Steam and Xbox in February 2026.

A dungeon-crawling, roguelike deckbuilder spin-off of Vampire Survivors, Vampire Crawlers, was announced during the Xbox Partner Preview event last year, with a Day One release set for Game Pass Premium and Ultimate. The title is scheduled to arrive in 2026, but could be delayed if the devs think it isn’t ready. However, whether it is ready or not, players can try out the game next month on Xbox and Steam through a new demo.

Vampire Crawlers Demo Announced for Steam and Xbox

As revealed through Episode 1 of “Let’s Explore Vampire Crawlers” on YouTube, the demo for Vampire Crawlers will release on February 23 for Steam and Xbox. The video also talks more about the upcoming title, with the devs revealing the main focus this time is “fast turn-based combat”. The devs have recognised that one of the main complaints about some of the most popular turn-based games is that they can be slow and repetitive, and that’s what they want to change.

To circumvent this issue, many devs offer ways to speed up the gameplay by introducing “fast-forward” or “skip-animation” features. However, animations in the games are where all the fun lies, which is why in Vampire Crawlers, players don’t need to wait for the animation to complete to trigger the next abilities. What’s more, the game will not just attack enemies in the front, but will spread to all targets.

The new feature, called Turbo Turn, enables players to perform rapid attacks on enemies without requiring excessive resource management. This feature is particularly beneficial for beginners. However, there’s also something for veterans of the genre. As you play and progress, you can find relics and treasures that unlock new gameplay options involving the cards. Additionally, there’s a gem customization mechanic that allows players to enhance their cards with various effects.

In other news, Vampire: The Masquerage – Bloodhunt is going offline in April 2026. Will you be trying out the Vampire Crawlers demo next month? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Forza Horizon 6’s early access still costing $60 for Game Pass subscribers. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Forza Horizon 6 Car List—How Many Cars & Every Forza Horizon 6 Car, Explained
item.content:encoded:
All Gearheads and Petrolheads are eyeing up Forza Horizon 6’s car list like a hawk. For many, the gameplay and content are irrelevant unless you have a carefully curated roster of amazing automobiles, which is where this guide comes to your aid.

Driving around in a pretty car is a perk of the Forza trade. Pulling off an insane drift sequence is cool, and breaking event records is nice for a short time, but everyone wants to know what stick you’re driving!

Luckily, Playground Games is delivering on the car list front in Forza Horizon 6, and it’s going to be one of the best line-ups ever.

How Many Cars In Forza Horizon 6?

Forza Horizon 6 will have over 550 cars at launch, with developer Playground Games sure to add many more to the range as post-launch content.

So far, 93 cars have been revealed for Forza Horizon 6.

In comparison, Forza Horizon 5 capped at 902 cars when the game’s content line was finished. Many cars were added as DLC and seasonal updates throughout the game’s lifespan. FH6 is sure to be the same, and you should expect Forza Horizon to easily get near the 900 mark again, if not 1,000.

All Forza Horizon 6 Cars

Forza Horizon 6’s car range includes Alfa Romeos, BMWs, Ferraris, Lamborghinis, Nissans, and virtually every other major car manufacturer you’ve ever heard of.

If you have a favorite car you want to see in Forza Horizon 6, Playground Games is giving you the option to submit car ideas for FH6.

For now, here’s every confirmed car for Forza Horizon 6.

Forza Horizon 6 Cover Car, Explained

The Toyota GR GT is a new 2027 car that is debuting early in Forza Horizon 6, even gracing the game’s front cover art.

It’a beauty. The GR GT is described as Toyota’s “Most advanced vehicle,” and it’s more than likely a huge honor for Playground Games and FH6 to get first dibs on the supercar.

Check out the car in action during FH6 gameplay.

It’s a more general question than usual, but what’s your favorite car? Is it a vintage car from the 1960’s? Or are you a sucker for a premium, modern, top-of-the-line supercar? The place to leave your top pick is the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Until the game comes out, check out all Forza Horizon 6 Consoles and Platforms, if it’s coming to Xbox Game Pass, and the news that FH6 early access still costs $60 for Game Pass subscribers.

item.title: Forza Horizon 6 Early Access Still Costs $60 For Game Pass Subscribers
item.content:encoded:
Xbox Game Pass members will have to pay almost the price of a standard edition for Forza Horizon 6’s 4-day early access.

The Xbox Developer Direct finally gave fans what they were asking for: a release date and a gameplay deep dive for the highly anticipated racing title, Forza Horizon 6. Along with that, we also received details on the pricing and editions for the upcoming title, and it seems Game Pass players will have to put forth some extra cash for early access, more than the usual price.

Game Pass Members Have to Pay Almost the Price of a Standard Edition to Get Forza Horizon 6 Early Access

So, Forza Horizon 6 is available for free for Game Pass Ultimate and PC members; however, that only includes the Standard Edition. To get the 4-day early access, players will need to grab the Premium Edition, priced at $119.99/£109.99 GBP/€119.99 EUR. Game Pass members can get their hands on the Premium Edition by purchasing an upgrade worth $59.99, and that’s where the problem lies.

Players on social media have been calling out the increase in the price of the Forza Horizon 6 Premium Edition upgrade for Game Pass members. For the previous title, FH5, players would only need to pay $50; however, that has now been increased to $60, which is almost the price of a standard edition, $69.99. In the UK, the price for this upgrade is £59.99, the same as the standard edition costs in the region.

For those wondering about the Forza Horizon 6 deluxe edition, that has been priced at $99.99/£89.99 GBP/€99.99 EUR.

In other news, the PlayStation 5 release window for Forza Horizon 6 has been confirmed. Additionally, here’s what you need to know about the title’s Game Pass status. What are your thoughts on Forza Horizon 6’s early access still costing $60 for Game Pass members? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Fortnite leak revealing the Office collaboration skins. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: What Time Does Highguard Release? Highguard Times & Release Date, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Highguard is looking to claim the FPS crown in 2026 and is trying to do so under a cloak of absolute secrecy. Details about Highguard are few and far between, but release time info is available, and the release date is locked in.

So far, Highguard looks like a mix of first-person shooters rolled into one. It has Hero Shooter elements, you can ride huge beasts, there’s a free-flowing speed and nimbleness to traversal: It seems to do it all. People have been wondering when Highguard is coming out and what time you can start playing it, so let’s try to clear some of this up.

What Time Does Highguard Release?

According to Steam, it will be a universal 6 PM UTC launch for Highguard.

This could easily be subject to change, so take the information with a trusty pinch of salt. If you look at the SteamDB page for Highguard (It might have changed by the time you read this), it clearly says: “18:00:00 UTC.“

Given how little we know about Highguard and the lack of promotion, some people are doubting it’ll even release when it claims—let alone hit a specific launch time outed by Steam. Does Steam even know?

Keep checking back, as this information has huge potential to turn around. Or, we can all see what the fuss is all about come 6 PM UTC on release day.

Highguard Release Date, Confirmed

Wildgate’s Highguard is slated for a January 26 release date.

Whether it does or doesn’t happen is anyone’s guess. It’s one of the most bizarre games and releases in recent memory. Everyone may end up looking back on the confusion as a stroke of brilliance, or wondering how Highguard was ever going to work.

It could be telling that the official Highguard Trophy List revealed more details than the devs did. Check your PlayStation, Xbox, and Steam stores on January 26 at 6 PM UTC to see if the Highguard prophecy actually came true.

There’s been an extraordinary amount of criticism and backlash for a game everyone pretty much knows nothing about. If you, too, have thoughts, share them via the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Make sure to read through the full Highguard Trophy List, and check out full details on the game’s free-to-play status and platforms for the latest Highguard info.
